page.title: 01E of Everdon, Nr Daventry
page.content: This part of Northamptonshire is an unspoilt rural area, almost entirely agricultural. The only settlements which lie within the area are the village of Church Stowe, close to the Roman Watling Street, and part of the village of Farthingstone. The residents of both places are mainly either commuters or connected with agriculture. On the brow of a hill to the north of Farthingstone is an earthwork known as Castle Dykes, believed to be part of a medieval castle. Everdon Stubbs is an area of mixed coppice with standards. Carpets of bluebells are a feature in the Spring. Coppiced trees include sweet chestnut, sycamore and hazel and standards are dominated by the oak. There are also some rowan trees and the area has been designated an SSSI because of these & the wild daffodils.
